page.title: 14Tissington Trail-Ashbourne.
page.content: { The Tissington Trail}follows the old railway line to{Buxton from Ashbourne. The rails were taken up and a crumbled limestone track was left.They made a path 13 miles long for pony trekking, bike riding and walking. There are picnic sites where people can enjoy the countryside away from noisy traffic and car fumes.There are bikes for hire at the booking office. A countryside ranger looks after the Trail.They show vistors where to go and make sure that the country code is obeyed.They ask people not to pick the flowers or disturb the wildlife.
